articles.headline: Iraq Reclaims 17,000 Looted Artifacts, Its Biggest-Ever Repatriation
articles.snippet: The cuneiform tablets and other objects had been held by the Museum of the Bible, founded by the family that owns the Hobby Lobby craft store chain, and by Cornell University.
articles.abstract: The cuneiform tablets and other objects had been held by the Museum of the Bible, founded by the family that owns the Hobby Lobby craft store chain, and by Cornell University.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: After Months of Avoiding the Vaccine Issue, Companies Begin to Mandate
articles.snippet: Tyson and Microsoft were the latest to require employees to be vaccinated. Other major employers have tried less sweeping approaches.
articles.abstract: Tyson and Microsoft were the latest to require employees to be vaccinated. Other major employers have tried less sweeping approaches.
articles.lead_paragraph: Some of the nation’s largest employers, for months reluctant to wade into the fraught issue of whether Covid-19 vaccinations should be mandatory for workers, have in recent days been compelled to act as infections have surged again.
articles.byline: By Michael Corkery, Lauren Hirsch, Brooks Barnes and Kellen Browning

articles.headline: ‘Completely Violated’: Women Describe Cuomo’s Groping and Intimidation
articles.snippet: The new account of a state trooper bolsters a meticulous new report on Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s misdeeds — and how his inner circle allowed such conduct to fester.
articles.abstract: The new account of a state trooper bolsters a meticulous new report on Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s misdeeds — and how his inner circle allowed such conduct to fester.
articles.lead_paragraph: The governor placed his finger on the back of the trooper’s neck, standing behind her in an elevator at his Manhattan office, tracing the path of her spine with a two-word narration: “Hey, you.”

articles.headline: After Months as a Covid Success Story, China Tries to Tame Delta
articles.snippet: The government has imposed lockdowns and is testing and tracing aggressively to fight a new outbreak. Experts say it is time for the country to rethink its approach to the virus.
articles.abstract: The government has imposed lockdowns and is testing and tracing aggressively to fight a new outbreak. Experts say it is time for the country to rethink its approach to the virus.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the battle against the coronavirus, few places seemed as confident of victory as China.
articles.byline: By Sui-Lee Wee and Elsie Chen

articles.headline: Amazon Faces Wider Fight Over Labor Practices
articles.snippet: A second union vote may be held at an Alabama warehouse, and new tactics by the Teamsters and other groups aim to pressure Amazon across the country.
articles.abstract: A second union vote may be held at an Alabama warehouse, and new tactics by the Teamsters and other groups aim to pressure Amazon across the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since the start of the pandemic, Amazon has ramped up its hiring, bringing on hundreds of thousands of employees worldwide. But challenges to the company’s labor practices are growing quickly, too.

articles.headline: Collapse: Inside Lebanon’s Worst Economic Meltdown in More Than a Century
articles.snippet: The small Mediterranean country is in the throes of a financial crisis that the World Bank has said could rank among the world’s worst since the mid-1800s.
articles.abstract: The small Mediterranean country is in the throes of a financial crisis that the World Bank has said could rank among the world’s worst since the mid-1800s.
articles.lead_paragraph: TRIPOLI, Lebanon — Rania Mustafa’s living room recalls a not-so-distant past, when the modest salary of a security guard in Lebanon could buy an air-conditioner, plush furniture and a flat-screen TV.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard and Bryan Denton
